name: Highest Farkle Score
description:
# Highest Farkle Score
Given an array of dice values, calculate the highest possible farkle score for that roll

# Farkle Scoring Rules
Farkle is a game played with dice. You roll 5 dice (other numbers of dice are used in some variations) and you score points based on what you roll:
- Each 1	100
- Each 5	50
- Three 1s	1000
- Three 2s	200
- Three 3s	300
- Three 4s	400
- Three 5s	500
- Three 6s	600
Any dice that is used for points in some way cannot be used again for other points i.e. if you use 3 ones to score 1000, you cannot also count them individually for 100 pts each.

# Examples
[1,2,3,4,5] - Here we have 100 pts for the 1 & 50 pts for the 5, for a total of 150 pts
[1,3,3,3,6] - Here we have 300 pts for the three threes, and 100 pts for the 1, for a total of 400 pts
[3,5,5,5,5] - Here we have 500 pts for three of the 5s, and 50 pts for the other 5 for a total of 550. Notice that each 5 scored individually would only add up to 200 pts, but we want to find the highest possible farkle score from the dice values
[1,6,3,4,5,5,3,2,1,2,3,2] - Here we have 200 pts for the 1s, 200 pts for the 2s, 300 pts for the 3s, & 100 pts for the 5s, for a total of 800 pts

# Notes
- some variations of the game use different numbers of dice, so be prepared to handle arrays of any length 1-100
- the input parameter will always be a valid array of length >= 1
- standard six-sided dice will be used, no need to handle any numbers outside that range
